etymologies: late 15th century. From life + rent. Compare Middle Dutch lijfrente (Dutch lijfrente), Middle Low German līfrente, German Leibrente

definitions: A rent or other revenue which a person is entitled to receive for life, without the right to dispose of the capital; (also) a right to use and enjoy property during one's life; the enjoyment of this right.

notes.text: A ‘proper liferent’ is created by disposition; in a ‘trust liferent’ a trust manages the property.

definitions: To assign (property, etc.) in liferent; to use and enjoy during one's life.
